addValidator(address).details: First adds the validator to the pending list, then calls the `callbackInitiateChange` of the Relay contract which emits the `InitiateChange` event

params._validator: The address to be added as validator

finalizeChange().details: The contract is assumed to implement the `IValidatorSetRelay` interface Only callable by the relay contract, which forwards the call from SYSTEM

getMigrationValidators().return: The list of addresses of the migration validators

getUnion().details: Returns the longer of the `current` and `migration` arrays

getValidators().return: The list of addresses of currently active validators

getValidatorsNum().return: The number of currently active validators

isActiveValidator(address).return: True if address is an active validator, false otherwise

isFinalizedValidator(address).return: True if adress is a finalized validator, false otherwise

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

isPending(address).return: True if address is pending, false otherwise

isPendingToBeAdded(address).return: True if address is pending to be added, false otherwise

isPendingToBeRemoved(address).return: True if address is pending to be removed, false otherwise

removeValidator(address).details: First removes the validator from `migrationValidators`, then calls the `callbackInitiateChange` of the Relay contract which emits the `InitiateChange` event

params._blockNumber: the block number which the report is for
the block number which the report is for
params._proof: the proof. It is not used right now

setRelay(address).details: The contract is assumed to implement the `IValidatorSetRelay` interface. Only callable by the contract owner

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

addValidator(address).notice: Adds a validator to the pending list and initiates a change. Can only be called if the validator is not in the active list, or there are no changes to be finalized. The validator only becomes active when it is finalized.

finalizeChange().notice: Called by the relay to finalize changes made to the validator set. Callable only if there are changes to be finalized.

getMigrationValidators().notice: Returns the migration validator set. If there are no changes in progress, the migration list is the same as the current list. If there are changes to the set, the migration validators list is the new active validators list that awaits finalization

getUnion().notice: Returns the union of current set and migration set. Useful for tracking the statuses of all affected validators in case of a change

getValidatorsNum().notice: Returns the count of currently active validators

isActiveValidator(address).notice: Checks whether the address is a currently active (sealing) validator. Note that it is not the same as `isFinalizedValidator`, because an unfinalized, pending-to-be-removed validator is still an active one

isFinalizedValidator(address).notice: Checks whether the address is a currently active finalized validator. Note that it is not the same as `isActiveValidator`. This returns false if the validator is still active but pending to be removed

isPending(address).notice: Checks whether the address is a pending-to-be-added or a pending-to-be-removed validator

isPendingToBeAdded(address).notice: Checks whether the address is pending to be added to the active validators list

isPendingToBeRemoved(address).notice: Checks whether the address is pending to be removed from the active validators list

removeValidator(address).notice: Removes a validator from the pending list and initiates a change. Can only be called if the validator is in the current list, or there are no changes to be finalized. Until the validator removal is finalized, it is still active

reportBenign(address,address,uint256).notice: called to log a benign report event

reportMalicious(address,address,uint256,.notice: called to log a malicious report event

userdoc.notice: This owned contract holds the actual validator-set logic. The Relay contract relays the function calls to this contract and they communicate through well defined interfaces.
